meanings.definition: The act of creating new words or expressions.
meanings.sent1: Neologising can be a fun way to expand your vocabulary.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys neologising and often comes up with unique terms.
meanings.sent3: The neologising contest at the school was a hit with the students.
meanings.sent4: In the world of neologising, creativity knows no bounds.
meanings.sent5: His passion for neologising led to the publication of a dictionary of his own creations.

meanings.definition: The process of inventing new terms or phrases.
meanings.sent1: Neologising requires a deep understanding of language.
meanings.sent2: The neologising workshop attracted many language enthusiasts.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's neologising during the show had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her neologising skills were put to the test when she had to name a new product.
meanings.sent5: The art of neologising is constantly evolving with the changing times.
